Raag Bilaaval − Part 001 795 : 1 One Universal Creator God. Truth Is The Name. Creative Being Personified. No Fear. No Hatred. Image Of The Undying. Beyond Birth. Self−Existent. By Guru's Grace: 795 : 2 Raag Bilaaval, First Mehl, Chau−Padas, First House: 795 : 3 You are the Emperor, and I call You a chief − how does this add to Your greatness? 795 : 4 As You permit me, I praise You, O Lord and Master; I am ignorant, and I cannot chant Your Praises. ||1|| 795 : 5 Please bless me with such understanding, that I may sing Your Glorious Praises. 795 : 6 May I dwell in Truth, according to Your Will. ||1||Pause|| 795 : 7 Whatever has happened, has all come from You. You are All−knowing. 795 : 8 Your limits cannot be known, O my Lord and Master; I am blind − what wisdom do I have? ||2|| 795 : 9 2

What should I say? While talking, I talk of seeing, but I cannot describe the indescribable. 795 : 10 As it pleases Your Will, I speak; it is just the tiniest bit of Your greatness. ||3|| 795 : 11 Among so many dogs, I am an outcast; I bark for my body's belly. 795 : 12 Without devotional worship, O Nanak, even so, still, my Master's Name does not leave me. ||4||1|| 795 : 13 Bilaawal, First Mehl: 795 : 14 My mind is the temple, and my body is the simple cloth of the humble seeker; deep within my heart, I bathe at the sacred shrine. 795 : 15 The One Word of the Shabad abides within my mind; I shall not come to be born again. ||1|| 795 : 16 My mind is pierced through by the Merciful Lord, O my mother! 795 : 17 Who can know the pain of another? 795 : 18 I think of none other than the Lord. ||1||Pause|| Raag Bilaaval − Part 001 3

795 : 19 O Lord, inaccessible, unfathomable, invisible and infinite: please, take care of me! 795 : 20 In the water, on the land and in sky, You are totally pervading. Your Light is in each and every heart. ||2|| 795 : 21 All teachings, instructions and understandings are Yours; the mansions and sanctuaries are Yours as well. 795 : 22 Without You, I know no other, O my Lord and Master; I continually sing Your Glorious Praises. ||3|| 795 : 23 All beings and creatures seek the Protection of Your Sanctuary; all thought of their care rests with You. 795 : 24 That which pleases Your Will is good; this alone is Nanak's prayer. ||4||2|| 795 : 25 Bilaawal, First Mehl: 795 : 26 He Himself is the Word of the Shabad, and He Himself is the Insignia. 795 : 27 He Himself is the Listener, and He Himself is the Knower. Raag Bilaaval − Part 001 4

795 : 28 He Himself created the creation, and He Himself beholds His almighty power. 795 : 29 You are the Great Giver; Your Name alone is approved. ||1|| −− Raag Bilaaval − Part 001 −− Raag Bilaaval − Part 001 5

Raag Bilaaval − Part 002 796 : 30 Such is the Name of the Immaculate, Divine Lord. 796 : 31 I am just a beggar; You are invisible and unknowable. ||1||Pause|| 796 : 32 Love of Maya is like a cursed woman, ugly, dirty and promiscuous. 796 : 33 Power and beauty are false, and last for only a few days. 796 : 34 But when one is blessed with the Naam, the darkness within is illuminated. ||2|| 796 : 35 I tasted Maya and renounced it, and now, I have no doubts. 796 : 36 One whose father is known, cannot be illegitimate. 796 : 37 One who belongs to the One Lord, has no fear. 796 : 38 The Creator acts, and causes all to act. ||3|| 6

796 : 39 One who dies in the Word of the Shabad conquers his mind, through his mind. 796 : 40 Keeping his mind restrained, he enshrines the True Lord within his heart. 796 : 41 He does not know any other, and he is a sacrifice to the Guru. 796 : 42 O Nanak, attuned to the Naam, he is emancipated. ||4||3|| 796 : 43 Bilaaval, First Mehl: 796 : 44 Through the Word of the Guru's Teachings, the mind intuitively meditates on the Lord. 796 : 45 Imbued with the Lord's Love, the mind is satisfied. 796 : 46 The insane, self−willed manmukhs wander around, deluded by doubt. 796 : 47 Without the Lord, how can anyone survive? Through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, He is realized. ||1|| 796 : 48 Without the Blessed Vision of His Darshan, how can I live, O my mother? Raag Bilaaval − Part 002 7

796 : 49 Without the Lord, my soul cannot survive, even for an instant; the True Guru has helped me understand this. ||1||Pause|| 796 : 50 Forgetting my God, I die in pain. 796 : 51 With each breath and morsel of food, I meditate on my Lord, and seek Him. 796 : 52 I remain always detached, but I am enraptured with the Lord's Name. 796 : 53 Now, as Gurmukh, I know that the Lord is always with me. ||2|| 796 : 54 The Unspoken Speech is spoken, by the Will of the Guru. 796 : 55 He shows us that God is unapproachable and unfathomable. 796 : 56 Without the Guru, what lifestyle could we practice, and what work could we do? 796 : 57 Eradicating egotism, and walking in harmony with the Guru's Will, I am absorbed in the Word of the Shabad. ||3|| 796 : 58 Raag Bilaaval − Part 002 8

The self−willed manmukhs are separated from the Lord, gathering false wealth. 796 : 59 The Gurmukhs are celebrated with the glory of the Naam, the Name of the Lord. 796 : 60 The Lord has showered His Mercy upon me, and made me the slave of His slaves. 796 : 61 The Name of the Lord is the wealth and capital of servant Nanak. ||4||4|| 796 : 62 Bilaaval, Third Mehl, First House: 796 : 63 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 796 : 64 Cursed, cursed is the food; cursed, cursed is the sleep; cursed, cursed are the clothes worn on the body. 796 : 65 Cursed is the body, along with family and friends, when one does not find his Lord and Master in this life. 796 : 66 He misses the step of the ladder, and this opportunity will not come into his hands again; his life is wasted, uselessly. ||1|| 796 : 67 Raag Bilaaval − Part 002 9

The love of duality does not allow him to lovingly focus his attention on the Lord; he forgets the Feet of the Lord. 796 : 68 O Life of the World, O Great Giver, you eradicate the sorrows of your humble servants. ||1||Pause|| 796 : 69 You are Merciful, O Great Giver of Mercy; what are these poor beings? 796 : 70 All are liberated or placed into bondage by You; this is all one can say. 796 : 71 One who becomes Gurmukh is said to be liberated, while the poor self−willed manmukhs are in bondage. ||2|| 796 : 72 He alone is liberated, who lovingly focuses his attention on the One Lord, always dwelling with the Lord. 796 : 73 His depth and condition cannot be described. The True Lord Himself embellishes him. −− Raag Bilaaval − Part 002 −− Raag Bilaaval − Part 002 10

Raag Bilaaval − Part 003 797 : 74 Those who wander around, deluded by doubt, are called manmukhs; they are neither on this side, nor on the other side. ||3|| 797 : 75 That humble being, who is blessed by the Lord's Glance of Grace obtains Him, and contemplates the Word of the Guru's Shabad. 797 : 76 In the midst of Maya, the Lord's servant is emancipated. 797 : 77 O Nanak, one who has such destiny inscribed upon his forehead, conquers and destroys death. ||4||1|| 797 : 78 Bilaaval, Third Mehl: 797 : 79 How can the unweighable be weighed? 797 : 80 If there is anyone else as great, then he alone could understand the Lord. 797 : 81 There is no other than Him. 797 : 82 11

How can His value be estimated? ||1|| 797 : 83 By Guru's Grace, He comes to dwell in the mind. 797 : 84 One comes to know Him, when duality departs. ||1||Pause|| 797 : 85 He Himself is the Assayer, applying the touch−stone to test it. 797 : 86 He Himself analyzes the coin, and He Himself approves it as currency. 797 : 87 He Himself weights it perfectly. 797 : 88 He alone knows; He is the One and Only Lord. ||2|| 797 : 89 All the forms of Maya emanate from Him. 797 : 90 He alone becomes pure and immaculate, who is united with the Lord. 797 : 91 He alone is attached, whom the Lord attaches. 797 : 92 Raag Bilaaval − Part 003 12

All Truth is revealed to him, and then, he merges in the True Lord. ||3|| 797 : 93 He Himself leads the mortals to focus on Him, and He Himself causes them to chase after Maya. 797 : 94 He Himself imparts understanding, and He reveals Himself. 797 : 95 He Himself is the True Guru, and He Himself is the Word of the Shabad. 797 : 96 O Nanak, He Himself speaks and teaches. ||4||2|| 797 : 97 Bilaaval, Third Mehl: 797 : 98 My Lord and Master has made me His servant, and blessed me with His service; how can anyone argue about this? 797 : 99 Such is Your play, One and Only Lord; You are the One, contained among all. ||1|| 797 : 100 When the True Guru is pleased and appeased, one is absorbed in the Lord's Name. One who is blessed by the Lord's Mercy, finds the True Guru; night and day, he automatically remains focused on the Lord's meditation. ||1||Pause|| 797 : 101 Raag Bilaaval − Part 003 13

How can I serve You? How can I be proud of this? 797 : 102 When You withdraw Your Light, O Lord and Master, then who can speak and teach? ||2|| 797 : 103 You Yourself are the Guru, and You Yourself are the chaylaa, the humble disciple; You Yourself are the treasure of virtue. 797 : 104 As You cause us to move, so do we move, according to the Pleasure of Your Will, O Lord God. ||3|| 797 : 105 Says Nanak, You are the True Lord and Master; who can know Your actions? 797 : 106 Some are blessed with glory in their own homes, while others wander in doubt and pride. ||4||3|| 797 : 107 Bilaaval, Third Mehl: 797 : 108 The perfect Lord has fashioned the Perfect Creation. Behold the Lord pervading everywhere. 797 : 109 In this play of the world, is the glorious greatness of the True Name. No one should take pride in himself. ||1|| 797 : 110 Raag Bilaaval − Part 003 14

One who accepts the wisdom of the True Guru's Teachings, is absorbed into the True Guru. 797 : 111 The Lord's Name abides deep within the nucleus of one who realizes the Bani of the Guru's Word within his soul. ||1||Pause|| 797 : 112 Now, this is the essence of the teachings of the four ages: for the human race, the Name of the One Lord is the greatest treasure. 797 : 113 Celibacy, self−discipline and pilgrimages were the essence of Dharma in those past ages; but in this Dark Age of Kali Yuga, the Praise of the Lord's Name is the essence of Dharma. ||2|| 797 : 114 Each and every age has its own essence of Dharma; study the Vedas and the Puraanas, and see this as true. 797 : 115 They are Gurmukh, who meditate on the Lord, Har, Har; in this world, they are perfect and approved. ||3|| −− Raag Bilaaval − Part 003 −− Raag Bilaaval − Part 003 15

Raag Bilaaval − Part 004 798 : 116 Says Nanak, loving the True Lord, the mind's egotism and self−conceit is eradicated. 798 : 117 Those who speak and listen to the Lord's Name, all find peace. Those who believe in it, obtain the supreme treasure. ||4||4|| 798 : 118 Bilaaval, Third Mehl: 798 : 119 The Lord Himself attaches the Gurmukh to His Love; 798 : 120 joyful melodies permeate his home, and he is embellished with the Word of the Guru's Shabad. 798 : 121 The women come and sing the songs of joy. 798 : 122 Meeting with their Beloved, lasting peace is obtained. ||1|| 798 : 123 I am a sacrifice to those, whose minds are filled with the Lord. 798 : 124 Meeting with the humble servant of the Lord, peace is obtained, and one intuitively sings 16

the Glorious Praises of the Lord. ||1||Pause|| 798 : 125 They are always imbued with Your Joyful Love; 798 : 126 O Dear Lord, You Yourself come to dwell in their minds. 798 : 127 They obtain eternal glory. 798 : 128 The Gurmukhs are united in the Lord's Union. ||2|| 798 : 129 The Gurmukhs are imbued with the love of the Word of the Shabad. 798 : 130 They abide in the home of their own being, singing the Glorious Praises of the Lord. 798 : 131 They are dyed in the deep crimson color of the Lord's Love; they look so beautiful. 798 : 132 This dye never fades away; they are absorbed in the True Lord. ||3|| 798 : 133 The Shabad deep within the nucleus of the self dispels the darkness of ignorance. 798 : 134 Raag Bilaaval − Part 004 17

Meeting with my Friend, the True Guru, I have obtained spiritual wisdom. 798 : 135 Those who are attuned to the True Lord, do not have to enter the cycle of reincarnation again. 798 : 136 O Nanak, my Perfect Guru implants the Naam, the Name of the Lord, deep within. ||4||5|| 798 : 137 Bilaaval, Third Mehl: 798 : 138 From the Perfect Guru, I have obtained glorious greatness. 798 : 139 The Naam, the Name of the Lord, has spontaneously come to abide in my mind. 798 : 140 Through the Word of the Shabad, I have burnt away egotism and Maya. 798 : 141 Through the Guru, I have obtained honor in the Court of the True Lord. ||1|| 798 : 142 I serve the Lord of the Universe; I have no other work to do. 798 : 143 Night and day, my mind is in ecstasy; as Gurmukh, I beg for the bliss−giving Naam. ||1||Pause|| Raag Bilaaval − Part 004 18

798 : 144 From the mind itself, mental faith is obtained. 798 : 145 Through the Guru, I have realized the Shabad. 798 : 146 How rare is that person, who looks upon life and death alike. 798 : 147 She shall never die again, and shall not have to see the Messenger of Death. ||2|| 798 : 148 Within the home of the self are all the millions of treasures. 798 : 149 The True Guru has revealed them, and my egotistical pride is gone. 798 : 150 I keep my meditation always focused on the Cosmic Lord. 798 : 151 Night and day, I sing the One Name. ||3|| 798 : 152 I have obtained glorious greatness in this age, 798 : 153 from the Perfect Guru, meditating on the Naam. Raag Bilaaval − Part 004 19

798 : 154 Wherever I look, I see the Lord permeating and pervading. 798 : 155 He is forever the Giver of peace; His worth cannot be estimated. ||4|| 798 : 156 By perfect destiny, I have found the Perfect Guru. 798 : 157 He has revealed to me the treasure of the Naam, deep within the nucleus of my self. 798 : 158 The Word of the Guru's Shabad is so very sweet. 798 : 159 O Nanak, my thirst is quenched, and my mind and body have found peace. ||5||6||4||6||10|| 798 : 160 Raag Bilaaval, Fourth Mehl, Third House: 798 : 161 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 798 : 162 Effort and intelligence come from God, the Inner−knower, the Searcher of hearts; as He wills, they act. 798 : 163 As the violinist plays upon the strings of the violin, so does the Lord play the living beings. Raag Bilaaval − Part 004 20
||1|| −− Raag Bilaaval − Part 004 −− Raag Bilaaval − Part 004 21

Raag Bilaaval − Part 005 799 : 164 Chant the Name of the Lord with your tongue, O mind. 799 : 165 According to the pre−ordained destiny written upon my forehead, I have found the Guru, and the Lord abides within my heart. ||1||Pause|| 799 : 166 Entangled in Maya, the mortal wanders around. Save Your humble servant, O Lord, 799 : 167 as you saved Prahlaad from the clutches of Harnaakash; keep him in Your Sanctuary, Lord. ||2|| 799 : 168 How can I describe the state and the condition, O Lord, of those many sinners you have purified? 799 : 169 Ravi Daas, the leather−worker, who worked with hides and carried dead animals was saved, by entering the Lord's Sanctuary. ||3|| 799 : 170 O God, Merciful to the meek, carry Your devotees across the world−ocean; I am a sinner − save me from sin! 799 : 171 O Lord, make me the slave of the slave of Your slaves; servant Nanak is the slave of Your slaves. ||4||1|| 22

799 : 172 Bilaaval, Fourth Mehl: 799 : 173 I am foolish, idiotic and ignorant; I seek Your Sanctuary, O Primal Being, O Lord beyond birth. 799 : 174 Have Mercy upon me, and save me, O my Lord and Master; I am a lowly stone, with no good karma at all. ||1|| 799 : 175 O my mind, vibrate and meditate on the Lord, the Name of the Lord. 799 : 176 Under Guru's Instructions, obtain the sublime, subtle essence of the Lord; renounce other fruitless actions. ||1||Pause|| 799 : 177 The humble servants of the Lord are saved by the Lord; I am worthless − it is Your glory to save me. 799 : 178 I have no other than You, O my Lord and Master; I meditate on the Lord, by my good karma. ||2|| 799 : 179 Those who lack the Naam, the Name of the Lord, their lives are cursed, and they must endure terrible pain. 799 : 180 Raag Bilaaval − Part 005 23

They are consigned to reincarnation over and over again; they are the most unfortunate fools, with no good karma at all. ||3|| 799 : 181 The Naam is the Support of the Lord's humble servants; their good karma is pre−ordained. 799 : 182 The Guru, the True Guru, has implanted the Naam within servant Nanak, and his life is fruitful. ||4||2|| 799 : 183 Bilaaval, Fourth Mehl: 799 : 184 My consciousness is lured by emotional attachment and corruption; is is filled with evil−minded filth. 799 : 185 I cannot serve You, O God; I am ignorant − how can I cross over? ||1|| 799 : 186 O my mind, chant the Name of the Lord, the Lord, the Lord of man. 799 : 187 God has showered His Mercy upon His humble servant; meeting with the True Guru, he is carried across. ||1||Pause|| 799 : 188 O my Father, my Lord and Master, Lord God, please bless me with such understanding, that I may sing Your Praises. 799 : 189 Raag Bilaaval − Part 005 24

Those who are attached to You are saved, like iron which is carried across with wood. ||2|| 799 : 190 The faithless cynics have little or no understanding; they do not serve the Lord, Har, Har. 799 : 191 Those beings are unfortunate and vicious; they die, and are consigned to reincarnation, over and over again. ||3|| 799 : 192 Those whom You unite with Yourself, O Lord and Master, bathe in the Guru's cleansing pool of contentment. 799 : 193 Vibrating upon the Lord, the filth of their evil−mindedness is washed away; servant Nanak is carried across. ||4||3|| 799 : 194 Bilaaval, Fourth Mehl: 799 : 195 Come, O Saints, and join together, O my Siblings of Destiny; let us tell the Stories of the Lord, Har, Har. 799 : 196 The Naam, the Name of the Lord, is the boat in this Dark Age of Kali Yuga; the Word of the Guru's Shabad is the boatman to ferry us across. ||1|| 799 : 197 O my mind, chant the Glorious Praises of the Lord. 799 : 198 Raag Bilaaval − Part 005 25

According to the pre−ordained destiny inscribed upon your forehead, sing the Praises of the Lord; join the Holy Congregation, and cross over the world−ocean. ||1||Pause|| −− Raag Bilaaval − Part 005 −− Raag Bilaaval − Part 005 26

Raag Bilaaval − Part 006 800 : 199 Within the body−village is the Lord's supreme, sublime essence. How can I obtain it? Teach me, O humble Saints. 800 : 200 Serving the True Guru, you shall obtain the Fruitful Vision of the Lord's Darshan; meeting Him, drink in the ambrosial essence of the Lord's Nectar. ||2|| 800 : 201 The Ambrosial Name of the Lord, Har, Har, is so sweet; O Saints of the Lord, taste it, and see. 800 : 202 Under Guru's Instruction, the Lord's essence seems so sweet; through it, all corrupt sensual pleasures are forgotten. ||3|| 800 : 203 The Name of the Lord is the medicine to cure all diseases; so serve the Lord, O humble Saints. 800 : 204 The four great blessings are obtained, O Nanak, by vibrating upon the Lord, under Guru's Instruction. ||4||4|| 800 : 205 Bilaaval, Fourth Mehl: 800 : 206 Anyone, from any class − Kh'shaatriya, Brahman, Soodra or Vaishya − can chant, and meditate on the Mantra of the Lord's Name. 27

800 : 207 Worship the Guru, the True Guru, as the Supreme Lord God; serve Him constantly, all day and night. ||1|| 800 : 208 O humble servants of the Lord, behold the True Guru with your eyes. 800 : 209 Whatever you wish for, you shall receive, chanting the Word of the Lord's Name, under Guru's Instruction. ||1||Pause|| 800 : 210 People think of many and various efforts, but that alone happens, which is to happen. 800 : 211 All beings seek goodness for themselves, but what the Lord does − that may not be what we think and expect. ||2|| 800 : 212 So renounce the clever intellect of your mind, O humble servants of the Lord, no matter how hard this may be. 800 : 213 Night and day, meditate on the Naam, the Name of the Lord, Har, Har; accept the wisdom of the Guru, the True Guru. ||3|| 800 : 214 Wisdom, balanced wisdom is in Your power, O Lord and Master; I am the instrument, and You are the player, O Primal Lord. 800 : 215 O God, O Creator, Lord and Master of servant Nanak, as You wish, so do I speak. ||4||5|| Raag Bilaaval − Part 006 28

800 : 216 Bilaaval, Fourth Mehl: 800 : 217 I meditate on the source of bliss, the Sublime Primal Being; night and day, I am in ecstasy and bliss. 800 : 218 The Righteous Judge of Dharma has no power over me; I have cast off all subservience to the Messenger of Death. ||1|| 800 : 219 Meditate, O mind, on the Naam, the Name of the Lord of the Universe. 800 : 220 By great good fortune, I have found the Guru, the True Guru; I sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord of supreme bliss. ||1||Pause|| 800 : 221 The foolish faithless cynics are held captive by Maya; in Maya, they continue wandering, wandering around. 800 : 222 Burnt by desire, and bound by the karma of their past actions, they go round and round, like the ox at the mill press. ||2|| 800 : 223 The Gurmukhs, who focus on serving the Guru, are saved; by great good fortune, they perform service. 800 : 224 Raag Bilaaval − Part 006 29

Those who meditate on the Lord obtain the fruits of their rewards, and the bonds of Maya are all broken. ||3|| 800 : 225 He Himself is the Lord and Master, and He Himself is the servant. The Lord of the Universe Himself is all by Himself. 800 : 226 O servant Nanak, He Himself is All−pervading; as He keeps us, we remain. ||4||6|| 800 : 227 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 800 : 228 Raag Bilaaval, Fourth Mehl, Partaal, Thirteenth House: 800 : 229 O Siblings of Destiny, chant the Name of the Lord, the Purifier of sinners. 800 : 230 The Lord emancipates his Saints and devotees. −− Raag Bilaaval − Part 006 −− Raag Bilaaval − Part 006 30

Raag Bilaaval − Part 007 801 : 231 The Lord is totally permeating and pervading everywhere; 801 : 232 the Name of the Lord is pervading the water and the land. 801 : 233 So sing continuously of the Lord, the Dispeller of pain. ||1||Pause|| 801 : 234 The Lord has made my life fruitful and rewarding. 801 : 235 I meditate on the Lord, the Dispeller of pain. 801 : 236 I have met the Guru, the Giver of liberation. 801 : 237 The Lord has made my life's journey fruitful and rewarding. 801 : 238 Joining the Sangat, the Holy Congregation, I sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord. ||1|| 801 : 239 O mortal, place your hopes in the Name of the Lord, 31

801 : 240 and your love of duality shall simply vanish. 801 : 241 One who, in hope, remains unattached to hope, 801 : 242 such a humble being meets with his Lord. 801 : 243 And one who sings the Glorious Praises of the Lord's Name 801 : 244 − servant Nanak falls at his feet. ||2||1||7||4||6||7||17|| 801 : 245 Raag Bilaaval, Fifth Mehl, Chau−Padas, First House: 801 : 246 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 801 : 247 He is attached to what he sees. 801 : 248 How can I meet You, O Imperishable God? 801 : 249 Have Mercy upon me, and place me upon the Path; Raag Bilaaval − Part 007 32

801 : 250 let me be attached to the hem of the robe of the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy. ||1|| 801 : 251 How can I cross over the poisonous world−ocean? 801 : 252 The True Guru is the boat to carry us across. ||1||Pause|| 801 : 253 The wind of Maya blows and shakes us, 801 : 254 but the Lord's devotees remain ever−stable. 801 : 255 They remain unaffected by pleasure and pain. 801 : 256 The Guru Himself is the Savior above their heads. ||2|| 801 : 257 Maya, the snake, holds all in her coils. 801 : 258 They burn to death in egotism, like the moth lured by seeing the flame. 801 : 259 They make all sorts of decorations, but they do not find the Lord. Raag Bilaaval − Part 007 33

801 : 260 When the Guru becomes Merciful, He leads them to meet the Lord. ||3|| 801 : 261 I wander around, sad and depressed, seeking the jewel of the One Lord. 801 : 262 This priceless jewel is not obtained by any efforts. 801 : 263 That jewel is within the body, the Temple of the Lord. 801 : 264 The Guru has torn away the veil of illusion, and beholding the jewel, I am delighted. ||4|| 801 : 265 One who has tasted it, comes to know its flavor; 801 : 266 he is like the mute, whose mind is filled with wonder. 801 : 267 I see the Lord, the source of bliss, everywhere. 801 : 268 Servant Nanak speaks the Glorious Praises of the Lord, and merges in Him. ||5||1|| 801 : 269 Bilaaval, Fifth Mehl: Raag Bilaaval − Part 007 34

801 : 270 The Divine Guru has blessed me with total happiness. 801 : 271 He has linked His servant to His service. 801 : 272 No obstacles block my path, meditating on the incomprehensible, inscrutable Lord. ||1|| 801 : 273 The soil has been sanctified, singing the Glories of His Praises. 801 : 274 The sins are eradicated, meditating on the Name of the Lord. ||1||Pause|| 801 : 275 He Himself is pervading everywhere; 801 : 276 from the very beginning, and throughout the ages, His Glory has been radiantly manifest. 801 : 277 By Guru's Grace, sorrow does not touch me. ||2|| 801 : 278 The Guru's Feet seem so sweet to my mind. 801 : 279 He is unobstructed, dwelling everywhere. Raag Bilaaval − Part 007 35

801 : 280 I found total peace, when the Guru was pleased. ||3|| 801 : 281 The Supreme Lord God has become my Savior. 801 : 282 Wherever I look, I see Him there with me. 801 : 283 O Nanak, the Lord and Master protects and cherishes His slaves. ||4||2|| 801 : 284 Bilaaval, Fifth Mehl: 801 : 285 You are the treasure of peace, O my Beloved God. −− Raag Bilaaval − Part 007 −− Raag Bilaaval − Part 007 36

Raag Bilaaval − Part 008 802 : 286 Your Glories are uncounted, O God, my Lord and Master. 802 : 287 I am an orphan, entering Your Sanctuary. 802 : 288 Have Mercy on me, O Lord, that I may meditate on Your Feet. ||1|| 802 : 289 Take pity upon me, and abide within my mind; 802 : 290 I am worthless − please let me grasp hold of the hem of Your robe. ||1||Pause|| 802 : 291 When God comes into my consciousness, what misfortune can strike me? 802 : 292 The Lord's servant does not suffer pain from the Messenger of Death. 802 : 293 All pains are dispelled, when one remembers the Lord in meditation; 802 : 294 God abides with him forever. ||2|| 37

802 : 295 The Name of God is the Support of my mind and body. 802 : 296 Forgetting the Naam, the Name of the Lord, the body is reduced to ashes. 802 : 297 When God comes into my consciousness, all my affairs are resolved. 802 : 298 Forgetting the Lord, one becomes subservient to all. ||3|| 802 : 299 I am in love with the Lotus Feet of the Lord. 802 : 300 I am rid of all evil−minded ways. 802 : 301 The Mantra of the Lord's Name, Har, Har, is deep within my mind and body. 802 : 302 O Nanak, eternal bliss fills the home of the Lord's devotees. ||4||3|| 802 : 303 Raag Bilaaval, Fifth Mehl, Second House, To Be Sung To The Tune Of Yaan−Ree−Ay: 802 : 304 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: Raag Bilaaval − Part 008 38
